p: Previously it was thought that the high levels of variation within the begomoviruses (circular ssDNA) was due to high levels of recombination (Lima et al. 2013), but begomovirues have substitution rates much higher than other DNA viruses, on the order of 10 âˆ’4 substitutions/site/year, in line with rates seen in RNA viruses (Duffy and Holmes 2008). Macroptilium yellow spot virus (MaYSV) and Tomato severe rugose virus (ToSRV), both begomoviruses, were analyzed for their variability. Interestingly, MaYSV, which primarily infects wild weeds, but does occasionally infect Phaseolus vulgaris (the common bean), had a greater diversity than ToSRV, which primarily infects tomato, and has a low incidence in wild plants. Several recombination events were detected for MaYSV, which drove the majority of the variability in the species.
